ISA (Individual Savings Account).limit: £20,000 per tax year (across all ISA types)
ISA (Individual Savings Account).tax_benefits: No tax on interest or capital gains.
ISA (Individual Savings Account).types: Cash ISA, Stocks & Shares ISA, Lifetime ISA (LISA), Innovative Finance ISA.
ISA (Individual Savings Account).coach_tip: Always maximize your ISA allowance before using a General Investment Account (GIA) to save on tax.

Lifetime ISA (LISA).bonus: 25% government bonus on up to £4,000/year (max £1k bonus).
Lifetime ISA (LISA).restriction: Must be 18-39 to open. Penalty for early withdrawal (25%).
Lifetime ISA (LISA).coach_tip: Free money for first-time buyers. Use this first for your deposit.

Pension.tax_relief: Government adds 20% tax relief automatically. Higher earners can claim another 20-25%.
Pension.employer_match: Employers must contribute (usually 3%). This is free money.
Pension.coach_tip: The most tax-efficient way to save for the long term. Don't opt out of employer matching.

Emergency Fund.purpose: Cover unexpected shocks (job loss, boiler repair) without debt.
Emergency Fund.coach_tip: Keep this in an easy-access Cash ISA or high-interest savings account. Do not invest it.

Debt Repayment.avalanche_method: Pay highest interest rate debt first (saves most money).
Debt Repayment.coach_tip: Pay off high-interest debt (credit cards) before investing.

Buying a Home.deposit: Usually 5-10% minimum. 20%+ gets better mortgage rates.
Buying a Home.coach_tip: Don't forget the hidden costs. Budget an extra £3-5k for fees and moving.

Inflation.description: The rate at which prices rise. Averages 2-3% historically.
Inflation.impact: Cash loses value over time if interest < inflation.
Inflation.coach_tip: To beat inflation long-term, you usually need to invest (stocks/shares) rather than save in cash.
